results.title: That's entertainment
results.brief_description: For over 50 years MGM produced an array of dazzling stars and musical spectaculars. “That’s Entertainment” is a compilation of snippets and sequences from nearly 100 musicals, featuring great moments with most of the studio’s major singing and dancing stars, including Judy Garland, Fred Astaire, Eleanor Powell, Gene Kelly and many more.

results.title: To the Lighthouse
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Virginia Woolf’s most popular novel. Set in a delightful holiday home in Cornwall overlooked by a distant lighthouse which holds a haunting attraction for members of this Edwardian family. A compelling story of family relationships.

results.title: Girl groups: the story of a sound
results.creator_credit: Steve Alpert, Stephanie Bennett and Delilah Films
results.brief_description: Traces the story of the dream girls, punctuating over 25 of their greatest hits with fascinating insights into what went on behind the scenes. Highlighted by rare original footage of the groups performing their hits. Includes : The Chantels, The Shirelles, The Shangri-las, Little Eva, The Supremes and more.

results.title: Monterey pop
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Lou Adler and John Phillips
results.brief_description: In June 1967, the Mamas and the Papas hosted a three day Pop Festival in Monterey, California. D.A. Pennebaker’s outstanding film is a record of extraordinary musicians and extraordinary insight into an era. This is the 60’s in celebration, exploding with new voices and optimistic energy. Performing artists include Janis Joplin, Otis Redding, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, Simon and Garfunkel, Scott McKenzie, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Canned Heat and The Who.

results.title: Show Boat
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The 1951 MGM film of the great stage musical, based on the 1926 novel by Edna Ferber, is a charming, beautiful entertainment with an endearing cast, including Kathryn Grayson as Magnolia, Howard Keel as the gambler, Gaylord Ravenal, and Ava Gardner, nominated for an Academy Award, as the tragic Julie Laverne.

results.title: Antony and Cleopatra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Mark Antony and Cleopatra have been enjoying a life of sensual pleasure. Hearing of his wife’s death and of an attack on Italy, Mark Antony returns to Rome where he resolves the differences existing between himself and the other triumvires, Octavius Caesar and Lepidus, by marrying Octavius’ sister, Octavia. However, when Mark Antony succumbs to Cleopatra’s enticements once again, and returns to Egypt, Octavius seizes upon this insult to his sister as a pretext for attacking his erstwhile ally.

results.title: Twelfth night
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Felicity Kendall as Viola, this is a production of Shakespeare’s comedy of magic, romantic deception and foolish love. The production features a talented cast, and it remains faithful to Shakespeare’s text.

results.title: Richard III
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Ron Cook as Richard III, Michael Byrne as Buckingham, Annette Crosbie as the Duchess of York. A succession of plots and murders sees Richard of Gloucester take over the throne of England from his brother Edward IV. But Richard has made many enemies along the way and Buckingham and Richmond raise armies against him. Richmond is the victor and, as Henry VII, plans to bring peace by linking the houses of Lancaster and York.

results.title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Gary Hannam, John Maynard, New Zealand Film Commission and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: The navigator is remarkable because of its absorbing story that links medieval fears and fortunes to our times, while confirming director Vincent Ward as an original talent. It is Cumbria 1348, the year of the Black Death. A young visionary tells his fellow miners that their community may survive the plague if they place a spire on a distant cathedral before dawn. So, from their grim, snowbound Lake District, they dig down an old mine-shaft to the other side of the world, emerging in an Eastman-coloured present day Auckland, New Zealand. Cast includes Bruce Lyons, Chris Haywood and Hamish McFarlane.

results.title: The Day After
results.brief_description: The Day After strips much of the myth from atomic murder to reveal with stark reality the catastrophe of a nuclear holocaust and its torturous effect on a group of average “survivors”. A moving and devastating drama about the effects of nuclear was on the citizens of Lawrence, Kansas. Rated: PG
